revised_title: Metalliferous Potential of the United Kingdom: A Discussion on Exploitation and Countryside Conservation
tldr: This article discusses the past and potential non-ferrous metalliferous mineral production in the United Kingdom, focusing on the value of these resources and their impact on countryside conservation. The author estimates the total value of past production to be £5.95 billion and suggests that future production in Wales and Scotland appears to be the most promising. The article also highlights the importance of considering the environmental impact of mining operations and the need for responsible exploitation of these resources.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Geology and Mineralogy
